category.name: Design
category.description: Master design principles, user experience, and visual communication skills.

sub_categories.name: UI/UX Design
sub_categories.description: Learn user interface and user experience design principles and best practices.

exercises.title: Advanced UI Components
exercises.description: Design and implement complex UI components with advanced interactions.

tasks.title: Modal Component Design
tasks.question:
Create a reusable modal component with advanced features.

Your modal should:

  • Have backdrop overlay with click-to-close
  • Support keyboard navigation (Esc to close)
  • Include focus management (trap focus inside modal)
  • Be fully accessible with ARIA attributes
  • Support different sizes and positions
tasks.hint: Use CSS for backdrop, JavaScript for keyboard events, and ARIA for accessibility
tasks.input: Modal with title 'Confirm Action' and content
tasks.output: Accessible modal component with keyboard support and focus management

tasks.title: Modal Accessibility
tasks.question:
What is the purpose of focus trapping in modal dialogs?

Consider: How keyboard users navigate through web content
tasks.hint: Think about keeping focus within the modal boundaries
options: To prevent users from clicking outside - visual containment
To keep keyboard focus within modal for accessibility
To improve performance - reduce DOM queries
To enhance visual design - better aesthetics

tasks.title: Dropdown Menu Component
tasks.question:
Design a dropdown menu component with proper UX patterns.

Your dropdown should:

  • Open on click/hover with smooth animation
  • Close when clicking outside or pressing Esc
  • Support keyboard navigation (arrow keys)
  • Show active/hover states clearly
  • Be accessible to screen readers
tasks.hint: Use CSS transitions for animations, JavaScript for keyboard handling, and ARIA for accessibility
tasks.input: Dropdown with options: Profile, Settings, Logout
tasks.output: Accessible dropdown with keyboard navigation and smooth animations

exercises.title: User Research & Testing
exercises.description: Conduct user research and usability testing to improve design decisions.

tasks.title: A/B Testing Implementation
tasks.question:
Implement a simple A/B testing framework for UI components.

Your framework should:

  • Randomly assign users to test groups
  • Track user interactions and conversions
  • Store results in localStorage or similar
  • Calculate statistical significance
  • Provide clear metrics and insights
tasks.hint: Use Math.random() for group assignment, track events, and calculate conversion rates
tasks.input: Test button color: red vs blue, track clicks
tasks.output: A/B testing framework with metrics and statistical analysis

tasks.title: Statistical Significance
tasks.question:
What is the minimum sample size typically needed for A/B testing?

Consider: Statistical power and confidence levels
tasks.hint: Think about having enough data to make reliable conclusions
options: 10-50 users - small sample for quick results
Sample size doesn't matter - any number works

tasks.title: User Feedback System
tasks.question:
Create a user feedback collection system for a web application.

Your system should:

  • Allow users to rate their experience (1-5 stars)
  • Collect qualitative feedback via text input
  • Track user session data and context
  • Store feedback securely and anonymously
  • Provide analytics dashboard for insights
tasks.hint: Use forms for data collection, localStorage for session data, and JSON for storage
tasks.input: Feedback form with rating and comment fields
tasks.output: Complete feedback system with analytics and data visualization
